mdRecord.dcterms:title: Red Tavern, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Vaughan, Henry (American architect, 1845-1917) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In 1900 Edward F. Searles created a private guest house called the Red Tavern, which is said to have been made up out of several earlier houses. This reworking and moving of existing buildings was a common practice of Searles and his architect, Henry Vaughan who was responsible for the renovations. (http://www.methuenhistory.org/Sites/P_thru_R_Streets.html by Dan Gagnon, member of Methuen Historical Commission) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
